sources.data_found: Tempest Cluster Specifications: '10 GPU nodes, each with 2 NVIDIA A100 80GB GPUs.' (Total 20 GPUs).
News Release: Confirms the acquisition of Tempest (NSF OAC-1925267) replacing the older Hyalite cluster.
Office of Planning and Analysis (OPA) Enrollment Reports hub page for Fall 2024 data.

student_data.notes: Data sourced from MSU Office of Planning & Analysis (OPA) Fall 2024 Enrollment reports (Headcount by Major). Undergrad count reflects the 'Computer Science' major (approx 628); the Gianforte School of Computing also houses 'Software Engineering' majors (~100) which are not included in this strict CS count. Grad count reflects MS Computer Science. PhD count reflects PhD Computer Science.

gpu_resources.notes:
The primary research cluster at MSU is 'Tempest'.

CALCULATIONS:
- Tempest GPU Partition: 10 nodes × 2 A100 80GB (SXM4) per node = 20 A100 80GB GPUs.

Note: The previous cluster 'Hyalite' has been largely retired/superseded by Tempest; its legacy hardware (potentially P100s) is not listed in the current primary specifications.

analysis_notes: MSU Research Cyberinfrastructure (RCI) centralized documentation is clear regarding the 'Tempest' cluster. Student data is derived from the official OPA census dashboards.
